Not sure if it makes much sense to refactor this code at all. The code is auto generated by the snowball project and it might make more sense to fix this in the code generator. Any opinions?

@kottmann Agree that it would definitely be good to fix it in the [generator](https://github.com/snowballstem/snowball/blob/master/compiler/generator_java.c). That would fix new stemmers but the old ones would still have camelCase names unless we regenerate all of them at that time.

I'm getting what I think may be the same error on Amazon Linux when building the 1.8.0 tag.

`[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.17:check (validate) on project opennlp: Execution validate of goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.17:check failed: Plugin org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.17 or one of its dependencies could not be resolved: Could not find artifact com.sun:tools:jar:1.8.0 at specified path /usr/lib/jvm/java-1.8.0-openjdk-1.8.0.121-0.b13.29.amzn1.x86_64/jre/../lib/tools.jar -> [Help 1]`

The problem was due to using a JRE instead of a JDK. When changing to the JDK there is no problem with the build.

@smarthi You could do that, but it is automatically enabled if you add the eval test data path. E.g.
mvn test -DOPENNLP_DATA_DIR=/apache/opennlp-data-dir

you can also run a single test by adding -Dtest=testname
E.g.
mvn test -DOPENNLP_DATA_DIR=/apache/opennlp-data-dir -Dtest=Conll00ChunkerEval

However there is small problem with the Eval tests you need a lot of memory to run them all. And I had some JVM crashes in ConllXPosTaggerEval as I remember @kottmann says we might have to split or move the test out of eval. This fix was just to enable ALL the eval tests (again) because previous commit only ran the SourceForgeModelEval.

Why can't we remove those Deprecated methods - they have been deprecated in 1.7.2 and can as well be purged from 1.8.1

@smarthi These methods are used and a part of the training code, but they should not be part of the public API. Therefore it was decided to deprecate them and then later to reduce the visibility of them. Our users should not use them directly.

Not yet; there's an NPE when trying to use it for conversion and I haven't found why. Getting time to go back to it has proven more difficult than I'd expected

Ohh, hmm, too late. Now I merged it, we thought it was fine. Then we will need to fix that before the release. I suggest we open a new jira. I can also have a look in case you don't find it. I am very good in fixing NPEs.

Ok; well, it happens when trying to match the surface form with its lemma, on line 245 of 
IrishSentenceBankDocument.java:
```
int rsize = flx.get(flexidx).size();
```

ok, lets continue this under O-1078

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OPENNLP-1078
